headline: Tuna Noodle Casserole from Scratch
description: This tuna noodle casserole from scratch features mushrooms, onion, peas, and canned tuna topped with crisp breadcrumbs for a comforting casserole.

video.description: See how to make a classic tuna noodle casserole from scratch.
video.name: Tuna Noodle Casserole from Scratch

name: Tuna Noodle Casserole from Scratch
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) package uncooked medium egg noodles
2 (5 ounce) cans tuna, drained and flaked

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Butter a medium baking dish with 1 tablespoon butter.
Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rapid boil. Cook egg noodles at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, 7 to 9 minutes. Drain and set aside.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet over medium-low heat. Stir in onion, celery, and garlic; cook and stir until tender, about 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium-high and mix in mushrooms. Continue to cook and stir until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 5 more minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.

Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan; whisk in flour until smooth. Gradually whisk in milk and cook until sauce is smooth and slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in tuna, peas, mushroom mixture, and cooked noodles. Transfer to the prepared baking dish.

Place remaining 2 tablespoons butter in a microwave-safe bowl; cook in the microwave until melted, about 10 seconds. Mix in bread crumbs until combined and sprinkle over casserole. Top with Cheddar cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made this with ahi Tuna that I baked then flaked. It came out delicious! I would make 1 and a half recipe of the sauce so it is creamier. I used a 10x10 Casserole dish. I also used 5 Tbsp of panko instead of breadcrumbs with the 2 remaining Tbsp butter. Will definitely make again

The recipe is great just as it is. And yes it's made from scratch. What are you gonna do ? Catch a tuna and can it? And the noodles are just fine. Those who did changes can't review this recipe and complain. Go by the recipe and review.

I really liked this recipe and that it didn’t include canned soup. I used ‘no yolk extra broad noodles’ and undercooked them slightly because they’d be cooked further in the oven. I added some dried dill and a dash of Worcestershire sauce to the bechamel. When I saw a review that indicated it was dry, I decided to include the water from each can of tuna. There’s a lot of flavour in that liquid so no sense discarding it. This was plenty moist and flavourful. Great comfort food recipe. Thanks to the original poster for sharing it.

This was a very good meal. I do not consider a dish that has prepacked noddles or canned tuna in it made from "scratch". But hey we do what we gotta do. I would consider a more flavorful way would be to make the egg noodles the night before, use fresh garden peas and try a small 6 to 8 oz (sized according to portions) fresh tuna steak. That's what I would call from scratch. :-)The flavors really pop with the freshest ingredients.

Love this easy recipe. I use a 9x11 glass baking dish. I add a few diced carrots in with the other veggies and saute them together, mushrooms, I use shallots and celery and English peas. I also add at least a cup of sour cream and blend it after I make a surry with mile and flour. I just love tuna casserole and thought it might be nice with some Gulf Shrimp added in too. Just a thought!

I have to use 2 frying pans plus a microwave safe dish and a casserole dish and a saucepan for the noodles? That's a lot of pan washing afterward. I can eliminate one frying pan and make the sauce on top of the sauteed onions etc. and if the pan is deep enough and oven safe, dump the cooked noodles in and bake the whole thing. I only make half a recipe anyway for the 2 of us. I use a Pyrex measuring cup to melt the butter and stir the crumbs right into it after melting. And the video shows draining the tuna in a sieve. Uh-uh - I just squeeze the top of the can down on top after opening it, over the sink of course, and drain out most of the juice that way. I'm all for the less cleanup, the better.
Pretty simple recipe. It could have used some more spices. A little plain Next time I will add some chili peppers or crushed peppers to mix. Otherwise a good quick dish to make. Thanks for sharing.
My family loves this! They all went back for seconds. The only thing that I changed was I added green beans instead of the peas

This is really delicious tuna noodle casserole! I will challenge myself next time to cut the fat a little, but hey that's what makes it a comfort food! I didn't use the bread crumbs and with all the noodles didn't miss them. I do think that the sautéed ingredients were delicious.
Loved the recipe & my wife loves it too. For personal taste, instead of 2 cups of milk, I used 3/4 cup low-fat (5%) sour cream & 1.25 cups milk.

I agree with some of the others that the flavor needs amping up, so I used some anchovy paste, fish sauce, and clam juice. Also topping with some panko and french fried onion rings. I'm making it again tonight, in fact!

I was really disappointed in this recipe. It was EXTREMELY DRY. . . Didn't have the lovely melted cheesy taste at all. Didn't take too long to make, but there was a lot leftover. . . 

I would not recommend this recipe!
This was a nice easy meal. My children loved it.

This recipe worked great as a basic recipe for tuna casserole. I ended up doubling the recipe so I could use my large casserole dish and feed my always hungry family of 4. I added sauteed peppers and thinly sliced carrots, left out the onion (used onion powder instead), and used 2 cups milk and 2 cups chicken broth. I turned out superb!
Yummy! No matter how you tweak it.. it’s great!
This is a great base for tuna noodle casserole. It is ok the way it is, but it needs more seasoning to heighten the flavor. I like to top mine with crushed Ritz crackers.

I make this one a lot. It is so versatile. Use shells or egg noodles. Top with panko or fried onions. But I always add Maggi jugo and a bit of nutmeg to the roux for depth.

Plus I never add cheese 'cause cheese and fish is gross.
I made this tonight very good I like that it’s from scratch.
Delicious substituted milk for original almond milk.

I prepared this recipe exactly as written, and IMHO it was absolutely delicious. I would recommend that you buy quality tuna, as inferior fish can greatly affect the flavour of the dish. Other than that, make changes if you want to, of course, but the recipe as it stands certainly doesn't need any help.

It was very good and so nice to try a recipe from scratch. Some people said it was dry but ours wasn't dry. I ended up using 1 cup milk and 1 cup chicken stock only because I ran out of milk and it was still fine. I'll probably add more spices now that I've tried the original recipe. Will definitely do again.
Easy recipe. Delicious. No canned cream od any soup required. A “keeper.”

Added extra garlic, thyme and cayenne pepper to kick up the flavor. I also used bread crumbs without the butter to cut back on fat, used unflavored soy milk and used a cheddar/Parmesan cheese mixture on top.
Very easy and tasty recipe!
Add cayenne pepper and cream cheese.

We had a guest who avoids dairy and gluten and prefers lower sodium if possible. So I modified the resume (1) to replace butter with tahini (you need to use a lot more than you do the called-for amount of butter; you could also use olive oil) (2) to replace wheat noodles with flat, brown rice noodles -- Taste Republic gluten-free fettucine) and (3) soy milk instead of milk . And I used fake cheese (Parmela Creamery plant-based mozzarella). It was quite good if a bit dry; next time I'll use a lot more soy milk and switch to olive oil.

My tuna casserole snob hubby LOVED this casserole. Very easy to make and very tasty. He said this was the best version I've made, and trust me I've made several. Not easy to make it like his mom's, but this was a close as it gets. Higly recommend.
I thought it was delicious! I followed the recipe with exception to adding cream cheese to the sauce and I did add thyme. I also doubled the garlic. Wonderful recipe.

I doubled the garlic and salted the veggies as they were sauteeing. Doubled the cheese and added half of it to the white sauce. Also added an extra can of tuna. I still thought it was bland. 

The best part was adding french fried onions to the top in place of bread crumbs. I'll make again because the hubby loved it and had seconds. I plan to add more salt to the white sauce next time.
Only subs I made were spraying with PAM and using peas and carrots for my veges. Good base recipe. Could be even used for chicken pot pie. My 6 yo loved it so much.

Definitely a keeper. I used evaporated milk (one can plus one-third can water) and added a tablespoon of Tony Cachere's Cajun Seasoning. Used mixed frozen vegetables instead of peas. Everyone liked it!
Definitely too much work to make this on a weeknight! Good taste though

I was hoping to find something as good as Tuna Helper from a box— unfortunately, this isn’t that flavorful.
I did find that if you forget mushrooms (or you discover that your mushrooms had gone bad like mine had) you can use one 10.75oz can of cream of mushroom soup and add half a can’s worth of milk (you’d omit the mushrooms, butter, milk, and flour originally called for).
Italian breadcrumbs is also a yummy sub.
I’ve tried this recipe with tuna as well as with salmon and it’s pretty good either way.
This was quick & easy. For a week night meal with everything already in the house was a blessing! We enjoyed it, & I will make this again.
Great recipe, I loved it but I substituted a red pepper instead of the mushrooms simply because my brother won't eat mushrooms.
Very dry. Not much flavor.

OMG!! This was DELICIOUS!!! My Husband & I loved it!!! I followed the recipe & added a few ingredients that was suggested by others. I first did the sauce as for 8 Servings, instead of 6 (this, to me, gave the creaminess that I wanted) and all other ingredients, I used the measurements for 6 Servings. I added about 1/4 tsp of Nutmeg, sprinkled Herbes de Provence, added lightly premixed dried, garlic, onion, black pepper & salt (I did have to add extra salt, I tasted the sauce as I was putting this in because I didn't want it too salty). I also added peas & carrorts (I had a frozed bag of the mix but I didn't put a lot of it...just enough to give it some beautiful colors to the dish). After putting the dish together, I topped it with the bread crumbs, but added panko crumbs for a little crunch. And as for the cheese, I also added a sprinkle of sharp & also mozzarella.
This came out: UH-MAZING!!! My Husband & I loved it & it's DEFINITELY a Keeper!! Thank u for the recipe!!

I make this with canned chicken, and it is unbelievably tasty! If you like the fishy taste of tuna, I’m sure it will be just as good! Regardless, it is soooo much better than tuna noodle casserole made with canned products!!!
I omitted mushrooms as my daughter won't eat them. Made a little more sauce due to others recommendations. Also added a bit of liquid chicken bouillon to the sauce to add flavor. Great flavor!

My husband LOVES this recipe and he grew up on it made just like this. People are doubtful - "canned tuna?" But this is a delish so far above canned anything. All from scratch and plenty of it. Leftovers are good too! I've made it many times and have this recipe in my "official" recipe book!
I made this last night, changed nothing.. It was absolutely the BEST Tuna Casserole, I've ever made.. Use panko for the breadcrumbs!! Delicious!!

The best casserole of its type I ever made. The addition of mayo and onion flakes and a dash of garlic powder and dry. Mustard made it so flavorful and creamy. I don’t measure the cheese just add what looks right. Cream of mushroom soup is always bland and needs perking up.

I doubled the recipe for a 9x13 pan and I'm glad that I did because it was a hit with the family and didn't last long.
I added more garlic and added some spicy smoked paprika.

I had some left over cooked noodles and had to do some trick to make it look like a new thing for my son ???? I followed the recipe and yes it turned out well.. added a little bit of chicken bullion, and chillie flakes as we prefer it a bit spicy to make it a little more tasty and did it with sausages instead of chicken as we are short of chicken during this lockdown period due to Covid 19 ?? all in all it was lovely
added all cheese to pot, paprika and red pepper flakes (I like spicy). Let butter and a bit more peas. No bread crumbs. Did not bake. Ate it right from the pan. Good!

Very good recipe and reminds me of eating this dish many times when I was a kid. I doubled the roux ingredients for a more creamy texture. This is one of the best recipes I have encountered, simple and as was previously stated...no “cream of mushroom soup” or “packet of onion dip” as part of the recipe. The wife loved it!

This was a great casserole and it froze well. Great meal for meal storage. Instead of celery I did it with carrots. Family loved it and asked for more. Family meaning my elderly parents and my 50+ brother. LOL!!
instead of frozen peas I put frozen corn because the last I made they were quite soggy

This hot dish took me right back to 1985! I had a craving for tuna casserole and loved how great this tasted without all the sodium from canned soup. I added a can of chopped green chilies, reduced the cheese and skipped the mushrooms for two kid eaters. Everyone devoured second helpings. Thanks for this delicious dish. I'll be making again very soon.

Not sure why folks thought this was bland. Produced my best batch of tuna noodle ever. Used criminal mushrooms and added in a few extra peas. And I layered in the salt and pepper throughout the cooking like you are supposed to do. It was delicious!
Couldn't even taste the tuna. it was all peas, mushrooms, and pasta.
Instead of top with bread crumbs, my mom made this and put it on buttered toast. It is a family favorite to this day! Delicious! I am going to try it with the toppings the next time.

My husband and I absolutely loved this delicious recipe!! I added 1/2 cup of sour cream to the sauce to make it creamier. Instead of using bread crumbs I topped it with one package of ritz crackers mixed with 2 tablespoons of butter. Will definitely be making this again.

I made this following the directions to the letter, except for adding a little chopped red bell pepper to the veggie mix. It came out very well, and my wife and I both love it.

My only problem was that the recipe underestimated by asking for a "medium baking dish"... by the time I got through putting everything together, the onion/veggie mix, the mushrooms, the tuna, and the noodles, I had enough stuff to fill a 13x9 pyrex dish. That's not a complaint; we've gotten 3 dinners for 2 out of this recipe. I also think it's a bit under seasoned, so I'll be increasing the salt/pepper, maybe a little cajun seasoning. Great recipe; we're keeping this one.

I have made a few tuna fish casseroles in my day and by far this is the best I have ever had. I could not stop eating it. I made it according to the recipe with minor changes. I chopped up the mushrooms versus slicing them and added a pinch of onion powder and parsley to the mushroom mixture. Instead of breadcrumbs I crumbled potato chips on top (I just prefer them over the breadcrumbs) adds a little more crunch. My husband loved it and said it was the best he had ever had. I will totally make this again and again. Thank you for an awesome recipe.

Very good! My picky 6 year old step son had never had tuna noodle casserole and loved it! He is already asking if we can just eat it tonight for dinner. Halfway through he asked what the green things were. He figured it out that they were peas (and he doesn’t like peas) but he continued to eat them. I had orecchiette pasta on hand that I used. I also made double the bread crumb topping and broiled the last few minutes
I loved this recipe and so did my husband.

I did make a few adjustments. I use any pasta I have on hand honestly. I do not always have egg noodles. I use a whole onion 10 ounces of mushrooms and like a bulb of garlic. I double the tuna and I add chicken bouillon for salt. I added bread crumbs then shredded Italian three cheese blend. When it’s close to done I add Trader Joe’s fried onions ( french’s onions tend to be too salty) I agree with another person I am tired of canned soup this and canned soup that recipes. Oh for those with kids who “hate” mushrooms I use a stick blender to make it creamier.
This is one of my favorite recipes! It's delicious and creamy. I use yellowfin tuna in olive oil and use three or four pouches. It's so comforting..

I did make a couple of changes. I didn't have any mushrooms so I just left them out. I also used home made type noodles but I weighed them out so that turned out to be the right amount. ALso when I combined the sauce with the vegies I added about 1/3 of an 8 oz. package of cream cheese and let it melt and combined it with the sauce. When I put the noodles and peas in and covered it with cheese I just let it sit covered on a very low heat while I got the rest of dinner ready. It was perfect.
I just made this and topped it off with flavored bread crumbs under the shredded cheese on top. I also added a little cayenne pepper to the mix.

This is really good. I used the advice of a previous reviewer and made the sauce with the mushroom/onion mixture. The cooked mushrooms fave the dish a good flavor. If you purchase precut onions, use about 1/2 a cup. 

I made my own breadcrumbs by adding 2 slices of sourdough bread to a food processor and grinding them up to get course crumbs. Toss that with the melted butter, and it gives you a nice crunchy topping. What I did do different was sprinkle the cheese on top first, and then add the breadcrumbs.

Used an extra can of tuna and about double the bread crumbs and it turned out wonderful. Wife even took it to work and shared leftovers with her friends. That says a lot in my book. Making it again tonight!!
This got a big thumbs up from the hubs. I used a little too much pasta and I did exactly what the video showed except no mushrooms. This is definitely a keeper

Made as written for a group covered dish thing..they loved it! Made this for at home..doubled up on muchrooms and celey..used skim milk and no cheese or crumbs...(hoping to cut back on a few calories) still very good!

Next time, I would add cheese into the body of the casserole as well as on top. It was good and not spicy - which worked well for us. I would probably add more garlic though. I also had 12 oz package of peas and used it all --- there were a lot of peas! Again, that worked well for us.
Sorry I waited too long to take a picture and everybody hasn’t finished eating. Really good!!!
No I didn't make any changes and will definitely make it again! Thank you!
This is exactly my moms recipe, lol. Its very good. I actually love tuna noodle cassorole and think its great. In the end, its an inexpensive meal that goes a long way for a large family.

My wife and I both loved this and I will certainly make it again. One change I will make is to make more bread crumb crust next time. Oh, and the bag of egg noodles was 12 oz so I cooked the whole amount and it was still fine.

This was so good! Just me and my husband, so I halved the recipe. We don't care for onions and celery...just our preference, so we left it out. I used canned chicken instead of tuna. We cleaned the bowl! Will definitely make this again!
I added cream cheese instead of the flour.
I made it exactly as written, it tasted good, but sadly was way too dry. I probably won’t be making it again, unless I figure out a way to make it not so dry.
My husband said, "you can make this again!".
Tasted great with additional salt when plated. I give it a 4 because it was quite dry....I may try adding some extra butter pats, or some kind of broth in it before the topping.
Yuck

Good, taken a bit longer than I estimated to put together.

Reasonably bland, but a little soy sauce on it after plating makes a big difference. Will make again. Also, I made it with mackerel which is cheaper and it suited the recipe well.

Added some cheese to the noodles, used some of my favorite seasoning along with salt and pepper, 
Very good will make again.
I made it exactly to the recipe, it was excellent, definitely enough for 4.....or nice leftovers for the two of us. I will be making it again for sure, the buttered breadcrumb topping were excellent
I followed the basic recipe but added a little cheese and thyme to the white sauce. Hubby liked it and even said he would eat it for breakfast!

I made this last night and found it to be very bland. At the table we added chipotle seasoning. Helped some... but needs something else. I liked the cheese... could probably use more. Maybe next time I will add velveeta cheese for moisture.
Great taste, easy to prepare. Did not use mushrooms as didn't have any on hand, but will use next time.
This is a keeper! Delicious!
The is the best recipe for Tuna Cassserole. I mad a 9X13 dish and it was gone in one sitting between 2 people.
no change
Delicious. Only change I made was to add a few drops of Tabasco sauce and to substitute crispy onions for the bread crumbs. As suggested by others I did everything in one pan. Used mafaldine noodles.
this has to be my husbands favorite meal and he loves the left overs
used French Fried onion rings instead of bread crumbs as mentioned earlier. This dish was a favorite for years using mushroom soup, etc., but no longer. Next time will add some corn and jalapeno's.

Very good made from scratch casserole. Making it with all fresh ingredients helped to cut down on the sodium that making it normally with creamed can soups. The fresh mushrooms enhanced the flavor. Before the bread crumbs and cheese topping I did season with paprika. Family really enjoyed and I will definitely use it as my go to tuna casserole recipe.
Loved it. Tasted great the next day as left overs to.
Really quick to make. Family loved it. I will make it again.
My family doesn’t care for tuna so I substituted canned chicken delicious and easy to make
Requires 2Qt casserole dish. Somewhat bland, lacks any bite, lots of salt & pepper at the dinner table. If you need a scratch recipe, try the Joy.

After reading others' reviews I made the following changes, and we were very pleased with the results:
Added/Increased:
-As I planned to freeze individual portions for a "Meal Train", I increased the amount of white sauce by upping the butter and flour portions about 20%.
-I added another 4oz of chopped mushrooms, doubled the garlic and added another 1/2 cup peas.
-I added crushed reds and fresh thyme to taste.
I added1/4 c. parmesan cheese to the sauce and1 heaping T. to the breadcrumb mixture - which I also increased, just because it's so good.
It was very tasty, thank you!

I did add the garlic AFTER the mushrooms, and then added a big splash of white wine. I prepared the pasta first, as suggested, and found that they were gumming up on me as I worked on the rest of the dish and they continued to cook, so I rinsed them in cold water.

I thought it was good but perhaps a little bland. Definitely two cans of tuna are required. I have never added cheese in the past, and that certaily adds some flavour and interest. It brings back memories from the past....... thank you!
This just didn’t have the same effect with the cheese just on top, but I did like the bechamel. I’ll try it again some time, and increase the cheese; mixing it throughout the casserole
Loved it! So much better than the quick recipe using can of cream of mushroom soup. Will definitely make it again.
This was very good, so much better than regular tuna casserole! Thank you for the recipe. I sauteed onions and mushrooms before putting them in.
I just left out the mushroom soup. It was really good, and my hubby loved it!
